ags:resource.dc:title: Proposing a Model for the Development of Electronic Logistics in the Ground Force of the Iranian Army through Utilizing Sense and Respond Approach
ags:resource.dc:subject: Military Logistics
Electronics Logistics
Sense and Respond Approach
Logistics Development Model

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Sense and respond logistics is taken as an adaptable logistics to the environment; it is also aimed to identify the requirements of its environment and is capable of adapting to the requirements. This study is an applied one and also descriptive-analytic in terms of purpose and data collection procedures. The study was an attempt to propose a model for the development of electronic logistics in the ground force of the Iranian army through utilizing sense and respond approach. For this purpose, the effective factors affecting the electronic logistics in military organizations were emerged and identified as a result of content analysis. Moreover, in a bid to provide a general model for explaining the relations among variables, this study was also conducted through utilizing interpretive structural modeling in military setting affiliated to the ground force of the Iranian army. ISM is identified as a technique of decision making and system analysis through utilizing the elites and experts opinions and consultation. This study was also conducted through engaging sample population of 13 elites and experts affiliated to the electronic logistics centers of the ground force of the Iranian army. The findings revealed that three main components of Sense and respond approach including stability; speed and flexibility are effectively affecting the military electronic logistics centers. Additionally, the crucial effects of electronic logistics components also including infrastructure of information technology, cargo tracking technology, well-timed production and distribution as well as capacity and ease of transportation. In this study, structural-descriptive equations were also run to evaluate the impacts and the effectiveness of factors. Finally, MICMAC analysis was also run to evaluate the driving power, correlation and the dependencies among factors.

ags:resource.dc:title: The Evaluation of the Academic Development of Faculty Members of University and Proposing Suitable Strategies for Its Enhancement (Case Study; A Military University)
ags:resource.dc:subject: Academic Development of Faculty Members
Organizational Development
professional development
Educational development
Individual Development

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: This study was an attempt to evaluate the academic development of faculty members of university and is also aimed to propose suitable strategies for its enhancement. Faculty members are identified as crucial human resources of higher education centers; therefore, the academic performances of universities are all deeply affected by their academic development. Faculty members are also identified as the most important human capital of every university and society and their academic enhancement is of crucial significance for universities and is also taken as an incontrovertible fact. Modern military education is an absolute necessity due to the rapid changes in military sciences in recent decades and the necessity for empowering the faculty members as a developmental approach and fundamental plan is sharply emphasized at universities. As an applied and descriptive field study, this study was conducted through engaging sample population of 94 faculty members of military universities who were selected based on stratified random sampling method. The findings revealed that the academic development of faculty members and its components including organizational, educational and individual development enjoys 0.05 rates of effectiveness and putting it at the top of the average level. The findings also revealed that in terms of academic development of faculty members, there is a significant difference among three faculties of Imam Ali military university at the level of 0.05. Moreover, in terms of mean score of faculty members, faculty of military management stood at the top of ranking among three faculties including military management, foreign languages and the faculty of flight and engineering. Additionally, the academic development of faculty members is confirmed by the factor analysis and its development is appropriately evaluated by its components. Finally, in a bid to enhance the academic development of faculty members, some practical suggestions are made according to the viewpoint of faculty members.

ags:resource.dc:title: The Components of Resistive Economy from the Viewpoint of the Supreme Leader-In-Chief; May His Shadow Extend
ags:resource.dc:subject: Resistive Economy
Knowledge-Based Economy
Economic Development
grounded theory
Imam Khamenei (the Supreme Commander-In-Chief
May His Shadow Extend)
Self-Originated Economy

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: In an attempt to explore the components of resistive economy from the perspective of Imam Khamenei (the Supreme Commander-In-Chief; May His Shadow Extend), this applied study was conducted based on data-based analysis and grounded theory. For this purpose and also in order to identify and explain the components of the resistive economy in thought of the supreme leader–in-chief, in terms of statistical population, the study was conducted through investigating the Imam Khamenei’s (May His Shadow Extend) discourse and statements between the years of 1993 and 2015. To address this issue, the features of components were identified and then classified through administering face to face interview with elites, experts and the commanders of Iranian army and also through library study. Thereupon, the conceptual model and paradigmatic pattern were emerged and developed as a result of data analysis. Moreover, 27 crucial components of resistive economy were emerged through investigating the viewpoint of the Supreme leader–in-chief; May His Shadow Extend. These components including knowledge-based atmosphere, making improvements to consumption model, the security of crucial and strategic issues, reducing the dependency on oil industry, advertising activities, reliance on national production, elimination of poverty, creating positive economic balance, growth and development, sovereignty of law, making attempts to pull the economic out of recession, privatization, self-sufficiency in agricultural products, extraction of mines and avoiding the crude selling, establishing the knowledge-based organizations, expurgation of the economic laws, building national and public self-confidence, consumption management, reducing the gap among people, consumptionism, extravagance, denunciation of luxury oriented-life, contentment in the life and making attempts to economize, appreciating the cultural value of work, building the developmental chain of science, scientism and finally providing comfort and protection for elites.

ags:resource.dc:title: The Evaluation of the Efficiency of Advanced Branch-Based Military Courses in the Air Force of the Army of Islamic Republic of Iran

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Given the crucial place of huge expenditure on advanced branched-based military courses in military organizations, this study was an attempt to evaluate the efficiency of advanced branch- based military courses in the air force of the army of Islamic Republic of Iran. In a bid to enhance the effectiveness of these courses, some practical suggestions are also made in this study. As an applied and descriptive field study, this study was conducted through engaging sample population of 339 university professors, students and commanders affiliated to the Esfahan advanced branch- based military training centers and also Shahid Sattari university of Iranian army who were selected based on simple random sampling. This study was also run through administering a questionnaire among statistical population. To analyze the data, the statistical analysis including variance analysis, one way Anowa, one sample t test, independent t test, Mann-Whitney U, Kruskal-Wallis H and Friedman test were also run in this study. The findings revealed that in terms of effectiveness of advanced branch-based military courses, all trainings, learning and reactions proved less than expected level and the obtained results are not significant in theses courses. Finally, the advanced branch-based military courses were evaluated moderate in terms of efficiency and effectiveness and implementation of these courses are highly beneficial to military organizations.

ags:resource.dc:title: The Assessment and the Prioritization of the Quality Dimensions of Educational Services based on the Servqual Model through Utilizing a Mixed Approach Including AHP and VIKOR (Case Study; Imam Ali Military University)
ags:resource.dc:subject: the Quality Dimensions of Educational Services
SERVQUAL Model
AHP
VIKOR

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Nowadays, the quality dimensions of services are taken as the most important aspects of management in organizations that provide services. Despite the increasing importance of the quality of services in the competitive environment, assessment of the quality of educational services is completely different from any other services and is an immensely difficult task due to its importance. Moreover, educational services are identified as the main distinguishing feature of universities and also bring students a great feeling of satisfaction. Imam Ali Military University is playing a significant role in training military forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran. To delve into this issue in this study, this study was an attempt to assess and prioritize the quality dimensions of educational services based on Servqual model through utilizing a mixed approach including AHP and VIKOR. Thereupon, the quality dimensions of educational services are weighed in terms of significance. The findings also revealed that in terms of prioritizing and ranking, the quality dimensions including tangibility, reliability, accountability and sympathy have been identified as the most effective factors affecting the ranking of educational services of three faculties including faculty of administration and military science, faculty of flight and engineering and also the faculty of basic science at Imam Ali Military University.

ags:resource.dc:title: The Assessment of Knowledge Management Level at Imam Ali Military University
ags:resource.dc:subject: : Assessment
Knowledge
knowledge management
Imam Ali Military University

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Assessment of knowledge management level is identified as scientific capabilities of educational organizations including universities specially Imam Ali military university and this phenomenon is of crucial significance for higher education centers affiliated to the Iranian army ground force. As an applied and descriptive field study and also in an attempt to assess the knowledge management level of Imam Ali military university, the study used a researcher-made questionnaire to collect the required data and its validity was assured via expert consultation while the reliability was estimated using Cronbach Alpha method releasing 91%. Moreover, both descriptive and inferential statistics including one sample t test and Friedman test were also run in this study. The findings of the questionnaire and expert consultation revealed that in terms of knowledge management dimensions, situation of Imam Ali military university is not acceptable and is far from an ideal situation. Additionally, among KM dimensions and components, the utilization of knowledge enjoyed the significance and stood at top of ranking while the other components were ranked orderly including knowledge assessment, knowledge sharing, knowledge getting, improving and expanding the knowledge as well as maintaining the knowledge.
